main event: An observer sighted a blinking white light traveling North in Pine Bluff, Arkansas on February 30, 1959.
interesting points: The sighting lasted between 5 to 20 minutes., The flight path of the light was reportedly different from prior observations., The observer described it as larger than a star, about 60 to 90 feet in diameter., The object hovered silently for about 30 seconds before shooting upward at a high speed., No photographs or physical evidence were available to support the sighting.
witness description: The observer was a Quantity Assurance Engineer working for Atlantic Corp.
